content:
Very hard for a clash in the end... BFS is always tough for 5-15 minutes.

I ended up beaten by a bot, which sucks. I got 75% and came second in Fastest mode. Bot got 100% at the last second. One human player got 25%, the rest got 0%.

The last test cases are tough enough that I wasn't able to optimise my code in time. My code was good, but I didn't notice that I was over-generating my queue in each step of the BFS, meaning that I was checking some cells multiple times per iteration, which was blowing out as the iterations got bigger... ".uniq" was all I needed to fix in the end, but debugging is always hard when you've only solved the problem in the last few minutes.
This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "REVERSE" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good work. Fun to solve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A little hard to code in 15 minutes, but it's good to also have hard clashes.

1. You have uploaded the same contribution twice. Please remove one of them.

2. Input section: Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines to present this section. In particular, please include line number and variable type in the descriptions.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

3. Please be consistent in the variable names: I think the width in the Input section is stored in [[m]] instead of [[w]]?

4. Goal section and Output sections: You may format the strings as constants like this: {{P}}, {{T}}, {{.}}, {{x}}, {{hurray!!}} and {{arghhh!}} instead of using quotation marks.

5. The constraints have to be revised as 1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 10 and 1 ≤ [[m]] ≤ 10, otherwise Test 3 and Validator 3 will violate the constraints as 10 is not less than 10.

6. I would suggest to vary the validators slightly more by swapping the positions of P and T.

Thanks.

The suggestion number 6 doesn't look as a good idea.

The expected output of a test stays the same when you reverse P and T.

So, adding this type of variation is quite useless.
I was hoping that it would be at least slightly better than before :shrug:
